title: Did you not learn from Warwick?
body:
Mystic Shot (Q) AP ratio increased to .5 from .4
Trueshot Barrage ( R) AP ratio lowered to .6 from .9

So AP ezreal is getting nerfed, because Runeglaive is a stupidly niche item which removes almost every weakness in AP ezreal. Not only that, but it looks like Runeglaive is also getting a nerf, with the wording sounding like the AOE only applies on monsters.

In fact, what is so stupid is you are buffing the part of his kit which is most of the problem at the moment with runeglaive, and nerfing the part of his kit which is massively telegraphed, easy to avoid and has been considered balanced for ages. 

NOT ONLY THAT, but runeglaive now doesn't convert the attack into magic damage, meaning Ezreal's Q's now won't benefit from magic penetration. This pretty much counteracts the .1 bonus scaling they added onto his Q, probably nerfing it some more. 

Congratulations, AP Ezreal now pretty much depends on Runeglaive in order to be effective. You have simply removed the power from his non runeglaiving kit, and pumped it into the part of the kit that uses runeglaive.

Edit: Obviously I posted this before they pulled the Ezreal PBE changes, we did it..uh.. boards.

replies.body: Junglers can't get anything nice without assholes exploiting it.
Would anything negative come out of a change that allows only one smite user per team?
someone who's salty that he didn't call jungle first so takes smite
What about teambuilder? Only the jungle slot can have smite?
AP Ez was a ticking timebomb for a long time there. Runeglaive just got people curious enough to try him out. He's always been this powerful. lol.
His power spike was just a lot more consistent since he didn't use tear anymore.

Well, it also converts his Q damage from physical to magical, which meant he was doing more overall DPS due to the fact that MPen now applied to Q.
Lich Bane needs to be changed so that it converts all physical damage from an attack that applies the Lich Bane proc (I.E an auto or Ez Q). This means it would give better damage than Runeglaive. Making it a better option. Problem solved.
agreed

thats the core problem of the jungle item idea, as soon as a jungleitem gets really nice, it also becomes valuable for laners.
You will never have jungleitems that are really statisfying that aren't at the same time abused by laners, unless you tie some junglefarming to it like devourer.

However if a jungleitem becomes powerfull and is kinda unique while needing jungle farm, it needs everyone to be blanced around it, so every one that can potentially abuse it has to be toned down so he's balanced with the item, limmiting their role to jungle, which is something i fear devourer is doing right now.
If you want to go for an on-hit built and scale meaningfull into late, devourer is kinda a must buy, so you have to go jungle. So soon, either those that scale really well with it and are kinda op right now get nerfed to a point where they need devourer and thus have to jungle, or devourer gets nefed till he has a not that statisfying powerlevel.

Tl;DR, jungle items will always have to be 'just viable' rather than great, else they will either force certain champs into jungle, or they will be bought by smite-laners.
Tell me about a single laner that takes Warrior enchant in this current meta
Given the current change on PBE for Warrior, I don't think even junglers will be taking it much longer.

As warrior stands on the PBE it's going to be best on high physical damage ADCs and AD casters. If a Graves combos you for 1.5 K you then burn for another 150 damage. If a Lee combos you for 800 damage you burn for another 80. It's just innately better on more damage loaded champs.

The junglers I think who will actually buy this item are guys like {{champion:107}} , {{champion:114}} and {{champion:23}} . It probably won't be particuarly good on {{champion:64}} , {{champion:59}} and {{champion:421}} .
it got nerfed to 6%, so it actually is rather weak now
It's still the exact same thing though. You need to deal extreme damage before the effect becomes noticeable.

just that it's now porbably not really an improvement to the 10 arpen, which in average increased you damage probably also by 6%...
It shifts the power a bit from early to late, which is nice, but overall it will just be more fancy without really changeing anything compared to the current warrior

>jungleitems that are really statisfying

>if a jungleitem becomes powerfull and is kinda unique

I don't know about you, but for me warriors isn't really statisfying, it gets the job done and gives a nice early powerspike, but it scales rather bad into the game and you will sell it as soon as you hit 6 items.

compared to the other jungle items, it doesn't seem very powerfull atm aswell, not underpowered, but slightly behind them.

It also has nothing special, nothing unique, it's a glorifyed brutalizer and it fits into the " 'just viable' rather than 'great'" spot i mentioned in the TL;DR
Uhh...when was devourer was exploited?

right after it's realease at v4.20, toplane WW and Shy with smite+devoure, despite the stacks from jungle clear...
though just like with cinderhulk, it was more the combination of challanged smite and the item that mad it really be a thing.
yep and we now made a roundabout into league of assassins because of it....AGAIN!

According to Scarizard: [The changes you see here are already being pulled - we're looking to see how the Runeglaive changes impact AP Ezreal's dominance as of right now. As it stands, the proposed changes here didn't really align with our goals for the future and so we're poppin' em out. We're talking about changes for Ezreal in a future patch, but the intent wouldn't be to nerf him or dramatically change his power - we think 'botlane' ezreal's been pretty weak for a while and want to find some improvements to him there specifically](https://redditjs.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3cpq0f/L/csxymfv)
Why.... why do I have to go to Reddit just to find information that should be on the official forums...?

Because Reddit is where actual conversations happen. 

The boards are just "OMG DONT LET NEW CHAMPS IN RANKED" "AMG AZIR NERFS IN PBE".

> [{quoted}](name=Imaginable,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=TenwEpAB,comment-id=000800000000,timestamp=2015-07-10T00:36:13.366+0000)
>
> Because Reddit is where actual conversations happen. 
> 
> The boards are just "OMG DONT LET NEW CHAMPS IN RANKED" "AMG AZIR NERFS IN PBE".

Nah, it is because Riot doesn't enforce discussion or communication from its employees on their own boards and basically gave them the freedom to use whatever channels they please such as Reddit, Twitter, etc. When Pendragon got called out about it he made the asinine claim that they were communicating about a given matter on the boards as well (a bug at the time) where it was then shown that there was no communication at all on the boards but several other locations did have info on the issue. He didn't come back to thread as he fled whimpering.

This is what happens when you have a Libertarian run the company according to his political beliefs.  Aside from enforcing obvious critical rules, developers are given free reign over what they do, how they communicate, and if they respond to anything their playerbase asks of them.
Can't go anywhere on the internet without someone bringing politics into it...

> [{quoted}](name=Retillin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=TenwEpAB,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2015-07-09T23:45:15.842+0000)
>
> Why.... why do I have to go to Reddit just to find information that should be on the official forums...?

Because Riot likes talking to mindless esports drones rather than real players that question their decisions.

Whats the point in even hitting Ezreal at this point, Runeglaive being turned into something that ONLY works on jungle camps (in terms of waveclear) is pretty much enough of a nerf.

Since it would put AP ezreal (relatively) right back where he started, with Runeglaive being a weaker lichbane for him, since he can no longer benefit from the waveclear in lane.

My suggestion would be to just leave AP ezreal untouched, and just hit runeglaive.

actually, i'm more for the other direction, leave RG as it is and balance AP EZ around it.
I don't know about any other champ that is a problem with RG, so why nerf the item if EZ is the only problem with it?( i still think RG EZ is a bit overated though)

Simple fact:

Balannce team enjoys going **full retard**.

They do not learn from their f*ck ups one bit.


But I'll tell you why Ezreals R was nerfed:
Because in LCS (but ofc) AP Ez almost 1shot glass-cannon Azir (fnatic).

If I ever lost any hopes for Riot balance team, then it'd be:
a) when they nerfed WW and THEN nerfed devourer
b) right now
c) When they'll nerf champions using new sated devourer just to nerf said item 1-2 patches later.

Meh with this. Meh with Riot.
As long as Blizzard won't hire anyone from Riot balance team, then we'll have new successor & leader of MOBAs.

EDIT:
Ok, I'm sorry for bursting like that. But I remember how game looked long time ago. 
We had some silly meta problems. Some champions were OP, some were UP.
But it never felt so pathetic-bad as now. For me it's almost the greatest truth, that Riot plays favourites here.
They nerf anyone or anything that might threaten their LCS dream.

Sooner or later one of fnatic gonna die from minions and I'M TELLING YOU, MINIONS WILL BE NERFED.

> [{quoted}](name=Saianna,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=TenwEpAB,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-07-09T23:34:02.564+0000)
> Meh with this. Meh with Riot.
> As long as Blizzard won't hire anyone from Riot balance team, then we'll have new successor & leader of MOBAs.

So, are you really happy with Blizzard's balance team? Have you played WoW? DKs were considered OP for almost the WHOLE of WotLK and literally the best 2s and 3s teams were DK, [insert healer], or DK, DK, [insert healer], or even just double dks... Or recently in WoD when ret pallies were strong they got nerfed across the board so they're trash again? Or when Hunters have been cc locking people non-stop in arenas? Yeah... That's just WoW which they have had 10 YEARS TO BALANCE and they're STILL MESSING UP BADLY.

Or, let's look at HotS. Nova can insta-gib people AND she's invisible with a 6.5 range which is longer than most "ranged" heroes... Or Illidan.... yeah... Blizzard isn't the shining light of balance you ignorantly believe in.

> Or, let's look at HotS. Nova can insta-gib people AND she's invisible with a 6.5 range which is longer than most "ranged" heroes... Or Illidan.... yeah... Blizzard isn't the shining light of balance you ignorantly believe in.
> 

Nova is also the ONLY hero in the game who can't waveclear. At all. And if she can't kill a target in a single rotation, she becomes ultra useless since even her autoattack have a decent cooldown (with her optimal talent path).

And honestly, its been pretty well established by this point that Illidian is a pubstomper. If you think he's a problem, then you're too new to have seen the REAL problem children, like release Thrall.

Blizz has no idea how to balance Hotstorm. Every time something becomes strong they annihilate it so it's not viable, then they buff the hell out of something else so it becomes the new OP. ETC and Diablo were useless at one point, then suddenly they were the best heroes in the game and now they're useless again. People reported you for picking Anub'Arak or Murky because they were deemed troll-picks, now people say whoever gets Anub'Arak wins automatically and Murky has one of the best winrates.
When I started playing Arthas and Stitches were the super OP heroes, now no one plays them. On the flipside, Jaina was useless back then and now she's the best hero in the game.
It's seriously a rollercoaster of ups and downs, there's no middle ground. Either it's useless or it's super strong.

> [{quoted}](name=Narasimha,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=TenwEpAB,comment-id=000900000000,timestamp=2015-07-10T02:36:33.918+0000)
>
> Nova is also the ONLY hero in the game who can't waveclear. At all. And if she can't kill a target in a single rotation, she becomes ultra useless since even her autoattack have a decent cooldown (with her optimal talent path).
> 
> And honestly, its been pretty well established by this point that Illidian is a pubstomper. If you think he's a problem, then you're too new to have seen the REAL problem children, like release Thrall.

My point exactly? It's like the place olaf was put into which gave rise to the term "don't OLAF the champion." If you really think that having a "pubstomp" hero that is only viable to pubstomp is cool, then Blizzard is no better than Riot. Remember Darius? Remember pre-rework Xin Zhao? Yeah they were "pubstompers" since they only worked against "pubs" who didn't know how to counter them and or didn't get to abuse them with a counter pick. If you are really in favor of champions that have been thrown into simply a "pubstomp" role when there is less than 50 heroes, how is HotS going to work with 50, 75, or even 100 heroes? 

Also, you failed to look at their track-record for balancing their games. I won't simply judge a company on a game barely out of beta for competitiveness and balance. However, the problems stated about WoW their largest game and the one they put the most time, money, and balance people into still has obvious balance problems and it's been out for 10 years. I mean if you are really happy with that track record it's kind of sad. If you have ever been over on the HotS forum or put some games in you'd see that not only do that have "balance issues" with simply the heroes their MMR system is completely and utterly trash. Almost every day there are people complaining about being with and or against players who are over 5-10 levels or multiple ranks (in the ranked system) on their teams. So, even from a simple competitiveness standpoint, their system seems to think it's ok to put bronze people vs golds or even plats (their system is different I know, but the difference is still the same)... 

tl;dr: Blizzard has a track-record of having multiple balance issues and their MOBA is suffering some very basic problems that they should have fixed by now or they are YEARS behind every other MOBA on the market.
Evelynn too and runeglaive no longer changes the attack into magic. So, why are they nerfing them?
Theyre pulling the changes, don't worry. Runeglaive is the target.

Could just play him as an adc..

Even if AP Ez works out we have better mages anyway.
Diversity anyone? No?
Riot never really learns from its design and balance mistakes sadly. Just look at how the new jungle items are treated, just like the old spirit items. and how they treat champs like kalista etc.

I just saw a note right below the change on S@20 saying those changes were going to be reverted soon. I thought to myself "I bet there's a thread complaining about it on the front page, anyway". I come to this board, and what do you know? I was right.
Good, AP Ezreals are huge tools. I don't want the build to be viable. They are even more douchey than ADC ezreal, which is an accomplishment
I've never played with a non-douchey Ez at all. It's like the champ attracts only prepubescent boys.

{{champion:53}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:238}} 

Yeah, only Ezreal attracts douchebags. 

Pretty much everyone attracts different tiers of douchebags, that's the nature of a PVP game. 

But don't worry: The AP Ezreal nerfs were pulled.

Of all those champions, the ones that truly are stupid are Yasuo, Zed, Riven, and Fizz.  I would also add Fiora to the list.

Yasuo gets that AA/spell blocking shield that is granted by movement.  He's a melee ADC with free ranged harass (only gated by cooldown).  His ultimate teleports him to any target in range that gets knocked up, and he does insane damage to them, while increasing the duration of said knock up.  His ultimate can affect a full team.

Zed's not so bad except his hidden power execution damage at the end of his ultimate.  Really frustrating to almost get away and he's like #Nope.  You can at least poke Zed until he gets lifesteal.

Riven is a one trick pony of forward moving wtf damage.  I don't mind her kit except for the fact her shield scales with AD.  Makes her hard to poke down in lane before she activates ult and destroys you.  You can punish her and kick her down in lane ... but once the laning phase is over, if you can't neuter her right then and there, she outscales you.  Luckily, everyone considers her trash tier feast or famine, and don't play her often.

Fizz ... Riot even said it was a troll pole.  I've had Fizzes time and time again just soak up lane experience, not even bothering to CS, and as soon as they hit level 6, jump on top of my two item champion and destroy it.  Mages, Marksmen, Bruisers, even Tanks.  The only thing I have against him for an advantage is he can't be in two places at once.

Fiora is a ball of self buffs.  She gets free regen from attacking.  She gets a dash, gets a second dash for free, both of which deal high scaling physical damage.  She starts the game with a Pickaxe instead of a Longsword like other AD lane assassins.  She gets a gigantic amount of free AS and a free Furor enchantment.  Her ultimate makes her UNTARGETABLE (eg, towers do nothing) and deals a significant amount of damage with high AD scaling.

One Fi is no where near op and it sounds like you are trying to insinuate on that. Play her if you don't believe me. Two, as a Fi main I'm offended that you think I'm a "prepubescent boy" or "douchebag". I may be energetic, but that's because friendly>toxic =/ I wish people wouldn't generalize. Sorry for commenting on you, couldn't resist.

The mains that people tend to call out for being toxic and douchy when they win, and whining bitchers when they lose are Riven, Vayne, and Ezreal.  Luckily, as I said, Riven is played far less and thus the few Riven players left tend to be quite good and usually not one of Those People.

I'm not saying any one of these champions are over or underpowered.  I'm saying that their kits are unfair.  Fiora is literally a ball of free stats, which, is actually one of the things Riot vehemently dislikes.  Not sure why Fiora is left the way she is, though.  It's probably a Poppy thing; not a big deal until you see her in the LCS, then it's panic rework mode.

She has two steroids yes, but thats not what they are for. The W is to reflect an auto, the E is to reset your auto. I wouldn't care if they took off the stat steroids as long as I had both of those.  Also, I'm glad I'm not the typical Fiora main via attitude =/. Freaking shame though that that's what people think all of us are like =(
I am severely offended that you put Veigar on this list

Why? If it doesn't pertain to you it shouldn't offend you. But in my _personal_ experience, these champions I listed attract horrible people to them. 

If you want me to be perfectly honest, the one that'd be closest to be taken off of that list for me is Teemo players. I've not had as many toxic Teemo players as anyone else on that list. Why? Teemo is bad enough, so most people assume that they don't need to be vile about it.
Jokes bro. It was a JOKE. Iz ok

Just another example of the rito balance team. I am convinced they are all business majors. If they got some science majors in there to help the people that actually code and shit, these stupid fuck ideas wouldn't go through. In fact, I told this to the support ticket thingy.
